title: Birth
description: Albert Einstein is born in Ulm, in the Kingdom of WÃ¼rttemberg in the German Empire.

title: Moves to Switzerland
description: Einstein moves to Switzerland, where he will later attend the Swiss Federal Polytechnic in Zurich.

title: Annus Mirabilis Papers
description: Einstein publishes four groundbreaking papers in the field of theoretical physics and quantum mechanics.

title: General Theory of Relativity
description: Einstein presents the field equations of general relativity to the Prussian Academy of Sciences.

title: Nobel Prize in Physics
description: Einstein receives the Nobel Prize in Physics for his services to theoretical physics and the photoelectric effect.

title: Emigration to the United States
description: Einstein renounces his German citizenship for political reasons and moves to the United States. He accepts a position at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton, New Jersey.

title: Einstein's Letter to Roosevelt
description: Einstein writes a letter to President Franklin D. Roosevelt suggesting that the U.S. should start its own nuclear program, which eventually leads to the creation of the Manhattan Project.

title: Death
description: Einstein passes away at the age of 76 in Princeton, New Jersey.
